channel.title: Documentation on Eclipse Hono™ Vers.: 2.2
channel.description: Recent content in Documentation on Eclipse Hono™ Vers.: 2.2

item.title: Getting started with Eclipse Hono
item.description: This guide will walk you through an interactive example usage scenario of Eclipse Hono. You will learn how devices can use Hono’s protocol adapters to publish telemetry data and events using both HTTP and/or MQTT. You will also see how downstream applications can consume this data using Hono’s north bound API regardless of the communication protocols used by the devices. Prerequisites for the Getting started Guide This guide requires several tools to be installed on your computer.

item.title: Concepts
item.description: Concepts Understand the concepts behind Eclipse Hono™.

item.title: User Guide
item.description: User Guide Learn how Eclipse Hono™ enables you to quickly send data from devices to business applications and vice versa.

item.title: Admin Guide
item.description: Admin Guide Learn how to operate Eclipse Hono™ and look up the configuration options of its components.

item.title: Developer Guide
item.description: Developer Guide Learn how to build Eclipse Hono™ and how to integrate your custom components with it.

item.title: API
item.description: API Documentation of the APIs defined by Eclipse Hono™. For an overview of the available APIs, see the architecture documentation.

item.title: Deployment
item.description: Deployment Learn how to deploy Eclipse Hono™ to various container orchestration platforms.

item.title: Architecture
item.description: Architecture Get an overview of the architecture of Eclipse Hono™.
